website_summaries.verdict: A great choice of fuel filter if you want the most value for your money. High quality will last longer than budget models.
pros: Virtually identical to the type of fuel filters used in vehicles coming off of the factory floor
Offers better value than getting a fuel filter replaced at a dealership or auto body shop alone
cons: Comes with a premium price tag for a higher quality filter

customer_reviews.title: He of course does not like to read directions but I do
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this for my husband. He of course does not like to read directions but I do! I had read online that you need to make sure the cap is screwed all the way on. He kept telling me it was. We went to lunch later in the day and the truck was acting up and it eventually stopped running. He called a friend out and guess what, the cap was not on all the way! So take the effort to actually make sure it is turned as much as it can go.
customer_reviews.author: jforhy

customer_reviews.title: Stuck in bracket, out of tolerance.
customer_reviews.text: Second time purchasing this filter, first time it worked perfectly and installed with ease. The second time did not go so well. OD of the filter for some reason was out of tolerance and once seated in the filter bracket would not rotate into position. Could not remove the filter either. Had to remove the entire bracket with filter and replace the bracket.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit and great price. I never changed my fuel filters on my 2015 F250 6.7 before. So I watched several YouTube videos before I installed this set. Installation was straight forward and took me about 20 minutes to complete beginning with getting all the tools required and so on. Everything fit perfectly. One thing I want to stress...do not turn on your truck without priming the fuel system first. Turn the key and let the fuel pump do it’s thing for 30 seconds and repeat 5 more times. Then start up your truck. You will thank me later.
customer_reviews.author: Klaus Kunkel

customer_reviews.title: Ford 6.7 fuel filter service kit
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install the filter, one hint, install the bottom filter first, the top filter, install the fuel line coming into the filter, the line line coming out attach a 1/2 clear line to the filter going into a container. turn on the key with out starting the motor and watch all of the air come out until only fuel comes out. now attach the fuel line to the filter and cycle the key one more time until the fuel pump stops. your truck is now ready to start.
customer_reviews.author: Alfred Trovao

customer_reviews.title: As expected
customer_reviews.text: A much more reasonable price for the Motorcraft fuel filters as compared to buying from the local dealer. Changing your 6.7 fuel filters yourself will save you a lot of money and isn't that difficult. My diesel mechanic has told me several times to stay with the Motorcraft fuel filters so I was glad to find these at a good price on Amazon. The item arrived on time and met my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: Make sure o-ring pocket is clean before putting on new o-ring.
customer_reviews.text: What's not to like about this kit. Delivery is quick and only takes about 15-20min to swap out. Only thing to pay close attention to is the plastic housing on the frame rail filter. You need to have the correct size socket and to turn slowly so you don't tear up the plastic. I recommend cleaning the threads on the housing and the truck side as mine had some dust/sand at the top of it. I used a couple wipes and a q-tip to clean it up before rethreading the cover back on.
customer_reviews.author: D Mac

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: If you have the dealer provide and install these filters (I replace every other oil change) they will charge as much as $130 parts cost for these same FOMOCO filters! It takes me about 30 minutes to install both top and bottom filters. That time and effort will go down somewhat upon repetition. If the bottom one was as easy as the top, I'd give the product a "5".
customer_reviews.author: Tony A

customer_reviews.title: Box was open and gasket was NOT included
customer_reviews.text: I received this and the box was open. Also, according to Ford, this kit comes with a gasket. Mine DID not. Also, one of the covers for the upper filter inlet and outlet was also not on the filter. Certainly different than the dealer, Autozone, Rock Auto, etc. Kind of seems like I have a returned and reshipped part.
customer_reviews.author: Mark63368

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Horrible product . Product is not what it appears to be . Product is labeled “Ford”, but is clearly not . Product is junk . After changing the fuel filter , my truck would not run , once I was able to get my truck running , the truck would only operate in a “ safe mode “ allowing me to drive only at 10mph. I bought a new fuel filter from the local auto store . I Changed the filter and my truck is running like it should .
customer_reviews.author: MRC

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: This is the correct stuff, The under hood filter was an extremely tight fit, next time I will make an effort to clean mount bracket and lightly lube the filter prior to installation. I have three 6.7s and this was the only time I had difficulty with the under hood filter.
customer_reviews.author: Michael N.

customer_reviews.title: 2011 Powerstroke 6.7
customer_reviews.text: Way cheaper than buying them from a Ford dealership and can't go wrong with the OEM parts. Super easy to change these filters but it would be a good idea to watch a couple YouTube videos before your first time. The frame mounted filter needs to be unscrewed a little bit before opening up the drain so you don't drain your tank although it still takes a fair amount of time to drain the fuel out...enough that you start to wonder.
customer_reviews.author: ezcmpny

customer_reviews.title: Fit my 2012 F350 As expected
customer_reviews.text: Fit my 2012 F350 As expected, not a super difficult job to replace on your own and I'm no where near a mechanic. If you have any Hesitation on doing this type of job yourself take a minute and go to youtube university and watch a video or two. Im sure that will either steer you away completely or give you the courage to tackle it on your own!
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great for diesel 2012 F250, O-ring can be installed wrong
customer_reviews.text: We do our own maintenance on our 2012 F250 diesel. These filters work great. One time we did have the truck not start after the fuel filters were replaced. It sounded like the engine was not getting fuel, even after priming the fuel lines as directed. The undercarriage filter was removed and the o-ring was cleaned and re-oiled. Everything was put back together and the fuel lines were primed. Truck started right up. We suspect the there was either dirt on the O-ring or it did not sit right and has not making a proper seal. This was more of an issue with our installation than the product
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great oem replace for less $$
customer_reviews.text: Great oem part at a discount! Be sure to watch install videos, I didn’t tighten enough after much warning the plastic housing on the lower filter is easy to break. Run for a bit and make sure to tighten to a “dead stop”, no more. Otherwise you will get low fuel pressure warning. My fault, product was perfect.
customer_reviews.author: John Wade

customer_reviews.title: Worked great and are actual Ford parts.
customer_reviews.text: Great prices for these genuine Ford components which were easy to install with a little help from some YouTube videos. Much cheaper than having it done at the dealer. I do cut apart the filters and keep samples of the old media to provide a more complete record of the conditions at time of filter change and provide better assurance to the next owner that these filter changes were made as prescribed and that there were no unusual particles trapped in the filter media.
customer_reviews.author: judb

customer_reviews.title: Everything fit just right / it's OEM
customer_reviews.text: This kit is 1/2 the price of what the dealer wanted. This fiter has (2) ports, the OEM had 3 with a plug on on of the ports. Make sure that the connectors on the under the hood filter are properly secured. I did the change no problem and three weeks later while diving received a "low fuel pressure" on the dash. Turns out i did not have it properly locked and the fuel line dislodged and sprayed diesel all over the engine compartment. :(
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Value priced, change it often to protect your 6.7
customer_reviews.text: Great Price. Much less than dealer price or parts stores. Cheap enough so you can change it every 12-15k miles. Do it yourself. And save even more than dealer or oil change places.
customer_reviews.author: XQZMOISVP

customer_reviews.title: Wrong is wrong
customer_reviews.text: Bought in advance of next oil/fuel filter. Found out today it’s incorrect. Using Amazon guidelines, this is the incorrect filter. No chance of return and don’t know what it fits...
customer_reviews.author: Randy  Speer

customer_reviews.title: Tighten up good. Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works as it should. Make sure you tighten the frame filter good. Till it bottoms out. I was over cautious, and under tightened mine. It's a big pain if it sucks air.
customer_reviews.author: Mike M.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect factory fit
customer_reviews.text: Don't bother with most non factory fuel filters, except Wix, as some of them have clocking tabs that don't quite line up with the factory fuel filter housing.
customer_reviews.author: Homey D. Clown

customer_reviews.title: OEM Filter for good price
customer_reviews.text: Quality OEM Filter replacement kit at a price far lower than the dealerships. Perfect for DIY mechanics who prefer (certain) OEM replacement parts to aftermarket.
customer_reviews.author: Josh S

customer_reviews.title: Exact fit!
customer_reviews.text: Exact OEM replacement. Stop buying your diesel filters at the dealer or auto parts stores!!! These are oem and half the price at box stores! Work great!
customer_reviews.author: Ed Wisenbaker

customer_reviews.title: OEM product
customer_reviews.text: bought for my 2013 Ford F350 diesel. OEM product. Fit perfect. Easy to replace and saved me over $100 from having a Ford dealer do the service.
customer_reviews.author: W. wright

customer_reviews.title: Buy Motorcraft fuel and oil filters!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit no issues always use good quality Oil and fuel filters. Stick with original motorcraft. Read owners manuals and do regular maintenance. It will save you in the long run. Check them air filters as well. Your engine CANT BREATH with a dirty filter. Sorry had to throw that in.
customer_reviews.author: Gunny V

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Little trick for people newer to this, the frame rail filter plastic housing has a hard back stop. If you do the proper bleed sequence and the engine won't start, check the lower filter housing. I did that and was one turn off. User error there.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great filters at a good price
customer_reviews.text: These are genuine Ford parts, not aftermarket "equivalents." With dealerships looking for reasons to deny warranty claims, there is no good reason to skimp on the fuel filters for your truck. You may save a few bucks on the price of a filter set, but when your fuel delivery system takes a dump, you will regret buying cheaper aftermarket filters. As the saying goes, "When you pay good money for first quality, you only cry once." Buy your filters on Amazon and you will save a ton over the price at your local dealership's parts counter.
customer_reviews.author: J. BAU

customer_reviews.title: Not happy
customer_reviews.text: I received the fuel filter kit and it was installed as per own requirements. After install I took the vehicle for a drive and after 2 miles it stalled. After hours of troubleshooting I ended up replacing with another fuel filter kit and no more problem. The o-ring seal was not sealing and the canister filter may have been damaged or plugged prior to receiving.
customer_reviews.author: matt kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Wrong Filter sent in kit.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the FD-4615 fuel filter kit for my 2014 F250 diesel. The bottom, white pleated filter is correct, but the top black plastic filter is not. I've tried to reach amazon to get the correct filter, but have been unable to make contact. Please advise me as to how I can contact someone to get this resolved. This is the third kit I've purchased and the first negative issue I've had.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Genuine OEM
customer_reviews.text: It’s what it says it is, a quality factory replacement for the 6.7. I wouldn’t see any reason not to use what ford says to use.
customer_reviews.author: BrianTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This is the best product to take care of my 6.7 Ford diesel, since using guarantees that my engine is taken care of properly.
customer_reviews.author: Herman Smith

customer_reviews.title: 1/2 the cost & all the benefits of DIY!
customer_reviews.text: Install: get gloves (Diesel smell on your hands isn’t nice for dinner date afterwards). You need 32mm socket, yes sometimes getting the lower filter cover off is tight. Catch Can that holds at least >1 gal. Rags, clean job is a good job. Value: OMG Ford parts house wanted $100 & change. Same box same box on amazon were half the cost!
customer_reviews.author: Bulldog crazy

customer_reviews.title: Will be ordering again
customer_reviews.text: OEM product safe and was plug and play type of fit I can’t complain and the price beat the big box stores. Will be ordering again
customer_reviews.author: Da_Craphter

customer_reviews.title: Diesel flow better.
customer_reviews.text: This filter is recommended to be changed every 22,000 mile I like to change every 15,000 because if you take care of you truck it will work more efficient and last longer. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Product works as designed
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. Box was nearly demolished on arrival but the filter appeared ok. When i see packing in this condition, i just wonder how was this handled to cause such.
customer_reviews.author: Informed Buyer

customer_reviews.title: OEM
customer_reviews.text: Other places wanted $110 for these filters. Finding them for half price is amazing. They work as intended and are motorcraft OEM parts.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Good Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Fit perfectly. Don't forget to spin the lower filter housing all the way until it stops when you reinstall or truck will not start. Cycle key to on position for 5 30sec intervals to purge lines.
customer_reviews.author: M. Partain

customer_reviews.title: Don't know why Amazon says these aren't for my truck.
customer_reviews.text: I received my fuel filters in about two days time from my order and they were in new condition. For the life of me, I don't know why Amazon says these filters don't fit my truck (2015 F250 w/6.7L) but they are the factory filters. Easy as pie to change them out on your own. They do, however take a great while to drain, so be prepared.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Vinson

customer_reviews.title: Stick with OEM!
customer_reviews.text: I always stay with OEM fuel filters to help avoid costly fuel system repairs down the road. Never know when you’re getting dirty or contaminated fuel. First place to check if your truck is running bad or seems to lack power
customer_reviews.author: BigRedDawg

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I'm a Ford master diesel technician,and I will not use any other fuel filters in my diesel truck. I've seem to many problems with trucks that have other filters.
customer_reviews.author: Frankie E.

customer_reviews.title: Nice kit, cheaper and easier to find than local
customer_reviews.text: Cheaper and easier to find than local stores. The local stores offer to order them, but the prices are outrageous. Kit has everything you need down to the O-ring to change the fuel filter on your SuperDuty. Easy as can be!!!
customer_reviews.author: Diver165

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality control
customer_reviews.text: I ordered them filter by the number the stamp on the filter said it was right but it was too tight for the canister so I had to force it in there with a pair of pliers cuz it wouldn't push down all the way so I'll not be buying from Amazon filters from motorcraft for my pickup
customer_reviews.author: Richard E. Carr

customer_reviews.title: OEM Filters
customer_reviews.text: I have always changed fuel filter and water separation filter every 20K. No issues so far. Better than street price.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: To the point
customer_reviews.text: OE parts, does what’s its suppose to do. And cheaper than buying them anywhere else.
customer_reviews.author: Lewis Williams

customer_reviews.title: Quality Control needs help
customer_reviews.text: Product was a great value UNTIL I opened box, the paper filter was smashed and the blue gasket was melted to the plastic bag it was in. Ended up going to Autozone to get replacement parts. Unfortunately I can’t return because I threw the old parts in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R.

customer_reviews.title: Factory Filters for the win
customer_reviews.text: Always go with a factory filter. Watch the YouTube video on how to replace. Super easy
customer_reviews.author: John J Morrissey

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit for 2012 F250 powerstroke
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit for my 2012 F250 powerstroke. Easy to install. Be sure to fully tighten the frame mounted fuel filter housing during re-install for proper seal. Tighten until you can’t turn it anymore. It’ll bottom out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Motorcraft FD-4615 Fuel Filter
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit and exellent quality. In my oppion you can not find a better filter than the Genuine Motorcraft filter for a Ford vehicle. It is built to the manufactures specifications which is what it take for the warranty to stay in effect.Even the Motorcraft gas fuel filters pipes and housing are made of stainless steel so that if you get a drop or two of water in the filter it does not rust and mess up your injectors
customer_reviews.author: Tuffy46

customer_reviews.title: Not Happy with this
customer_reviews.text: Not pleased at all!! Ordered this Fuel Filter because it was roughly $30 cheaper then the one at the auto part store, installed it and the filter is faulty and causing my truck to spit and sputter. Ended up getting stranded for a couple hours, then finally ended up changing the filter and all the problems were gone !! Never again will I buy
customer_reviews.author: Rese Charette

customer_reviews.title: Great filter and great price
customer_reviews.text: Great filter. This is easy to install and works great. The price is great on here in comparison to in store as well.
customer_reviews.author: Mindy

customer_reviews.title: Exact stock replacement for cheaper
customer_reviews.text: This is the exact stock filter replacement, just for a whole lot cheaper!! If you can wait out the shipping, go this route!!
customer_reviews.author: MaHammy

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works as it should make sure you prime your truck before starting.
customer_reviews.author: gordo!

customer_reviews.title: Great OEM and Great price.
customer_reviews.text: You save so much money doing this yourself and it is very easy. Comes with everything you need to replace the 2 fuel filters (excluding wrenches, etc.) Perfect OEM product.
customer_reviews.author: J.E.  CC, Texas

customer_reviews.title: A good buy,
customer_reviews.text: Motorcraft always fits my ford. I know what I am getting.
customer_reviews.author: WILLIAM J STEPHENS

customer_reviews.title: Factory filter set with all of the items needed for ...
customer_reviews.text: Factory filter set with all of the items needed for a fuel system filter change on my 2016 F-250 SuperDuty. Everything in one box. I change mine every 15,000 miles for peace of mind.
customer_reviews.author: Lee B.

customer_reviews.title: Do it yourself!!!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect replacement fit my 2013 ford f250 6.7 diesel. Great price. My ford dealer wanted $178 for this same part. And there super easy to change took 15 min. There are plenty of tutorial videos on YouTube. Save the $$ and do it yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Trey McClure

customer_reviews.title: Better price then the auto parts stores.
customer_reviews.text: Always stick with oem filters. This is good place to buy for a good price.
customer_reviews.author: III in SC

customer_reviews.title: Best deal around
customer_reviews.text: Very good price for OEM quality filters. Came with both filters and the O-ring gasket.
customer_reviews.author: ACDII

customer_reviews.title: Motorcraft Fuel Filters
customer_reviews.text: I only use Motorcraft Fuel Filters on my Ford Superduty as they are great quality, good price and have never let me down.
customer_reviews.author: Clayton Parks

customer_reviews.title: Everything worked out perfectly exact fit and I save myself a lot of moneyMoney saver
customer_reviews.text: Everything worked out perfectly exact fit and I save myself a lot of money
customer_reviews.author: JEFFREY BROWN

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit. OEM
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit. OEM. the bottom fuel filter cap takes a 32mm socket after draining the fuel/water and disconnecting the sensor. Be sure to lube the new o-ring with clean oil before install for ease or removal next time. Failure to do so may result in breaking out the socket plastic and you purchasing a new 9G270 fuel filter cap.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Fierro

customer_reviews.title: Genuine
customer_reviews.text: Genuine motorcraft product. Great price. Be careful buying motorcraft parts. Some are fake and may not work as well. These are the real thing
customer_reviews.author: Johnny

customer_reviews.title: It was the factory parts for my 2012 F250 Super Duty work truck
customer_reviews.text: It was the factory parts for my 2012 F250 Super Duty work truck, installed flawlessly and has worked perfectly since the installation. The value was great as it was half the cost of the local parts stores that had it in stock.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely perfect for my F250 King Ranch 2016 truck
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely perfect for my F250 King Ranch 2016 truck. If you watch the YouTube video on how to install couldn't be any easier took me a total 20 minutes to change out. This will cost you $250-$300 in a dealership to do.
customer_reviews.author: Topguncg

customer_reviews.title: Quality Item
customer_reviews.text: I always use Motorcraft products. I think they are quality products.
customer_reviews.author: GeorgeE

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: These were exactly like the factory ones. Priced them at the dealer was over $60 more.
customer_reviews.author: Squints2c

customer_reviews.title: Works as intended
customer_reviews.text: Exact fit, no hassle to install, OEM part what more can you ask for
customer_reviews.author: Don Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper than dealership.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I know they're are cheaper filter out there, but read the reviews. I'm not taking a chance.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Fuel Filters for Ford Diesel
customer_reviews.text: OEM fuel filters. Relatively simple procedure, saved myself the dealer labor costs and time that I would have waited at the dealership. I watched YouTube video for familiarization, then spent less than 45 minutes from start to finish.
customer_reviews.author: Mark R.

customer_reviews.title: Will buy again
customer_reviews.text: Good product. Package was damaged which causes concern about the care for the product!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Need instructions. Drained a gallon of fuel before I realized I was doing it wrong
customer_reviews.text: I couldn’t find these for less. Easy install. Need instructions for people like myself doing this for the first time
customer_reviews.author: Michael Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: This fuel filter fit my 2016 Ford F450 platinum perfectly It comes with both top and bottom replacement filter and water separator needed with new gasket This is the same brand as dealer sells and recommends
customer_reviews.author: AZ911TT

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: These were an exact fit for my 2011 F250 6.7L. Easy to install. No issues. I have purchased them twice now and have put over 25,000 miles on my truck with no issues from either set of filters that I've purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Factory stuff
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly, quick and easy job and I will be ordering these again soon.
customer_reviews.author: C.B.

customer_reviews.title: Stock filter replacement
customer_reviews.text: Stock filter for 16 F250 6.7 Cheaper than Ford wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Charles T

customer_reviews.title: Save some money buy and do it yourself.
customer_reviews.text: The dealer wants $250 to do the change for me. It was so easy I can't believe people pay the dealer. Took me 30 minutes so the dealer charges about $400 per hour to do this...ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: Mshelton

customer_reviews.title: OEM or Bust
customer_reviews.text: OEM! Dont buy anything else for your Powerstroke as the dimensions are not the same due to patents etc. Cheap insurance for a diesel.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: will use it again next time.
customer_reviews.text: was exactly what it said it was. the hard work was draining the fuel from the line. the kit had everything needed and basically plugged right in to each of the places it was supposed to.
customer_reviews.author: Alp acct

customer_reviews.title: I change with every oil change.
customer_reviews.text: Factory correct filters (2) for my 2015 F350 PSD. Diesels demand clean fuel. YouTube can show you how to change. Take your time. I change with every oil change (twice as often as Ford suggest). It is cheap insurance and easy to do. Just wear vinyl gloves as diesel fuel stinks.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie Dinges

customer_reviews.title: Factory OEM replacement
customer_reviews.text: It is a Ford OEM product so you don't have to worry about if it will fit or not.
customer_reviews.author: Mike R

customer_reviews.title: Ford f250 2012 correct
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit. No more whistle for need to be changed. Price was comparable.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Pay me back my lost . I got the mechanic bill
customer_reviews.text: It restricted the fuel to my truck to a point that it didn’t want to run no more have to pay $378 dollars to find out that it was Your damm product that it was not working
customer_reviews.author: carlos alvarez

customer_reviews.title: Great kit for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I like that this is a complete maintenance kit that uses factory recommended parts with an affordable price for us DIY's!
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Quality, cheap OEM
customer_reviews.text: Dont skimp on these expensive diesel engines! use only OEM fliters.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley B.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This is actually the exact same stuff that came on my 2015 F350. Just a hint, you have to twist the underhood filter to remove it, it won't lift straight up!
customer_reviews.author: Mark L. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good OEM, however the secondary filter is defective. Had to replace it with a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: They work.
customer_reviews.text: It's a factory set of filters for a fraction of the price. Installed on 2011 F250 6.7 Diesel. No issues 5k miles in.
customer_reviews.author: McMillan M.

customer_reviews.title: Great OEM fuel filter replacement for Ford 6
customer_reviews.text: Great OEM fuel filter replacement for Ford 6.7L Powerstroke. I have purchased two times and have had no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: OEM parts at a good price.
customer_reviews.text: Product was fine.Oem at a cheaper price. Very slow on shipping it.
customer_reviews.author: scottrace1

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great price and wonderful product since it is Motorcraft, it fit my 2011 F350 6.7 perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Jason F

customer_reviews.title: Fits as described, easy installation.
customer_reviews.text: Installation was easy and the product fit exactly as described. A cursory google or youtube search will bring up a myriad of videos with step by step removal and installtion instructions; all in all it took me about thirty minutes to change both out.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: OEM fuel filters work as you’d expect.
customer_reviews.text: OEM filters for the 6.7 power stroke easy enough to replace yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It did not fit.
customer_reviews.text: The upper filter did not fit. It was too large. I had to install the old filter to get back on the road. I have used Amazon for a lot of parts in the past but now I am unsure.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfect for my 2014 F-350 6.7. Easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Need to have original packaging when selling to customers
customer_reviews.text: Filter was not in original packaging and was placed in a small garbage bag.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Shuster

customer_reviews.title: Follow instructions and maybe YouTube
customer_reviews.text: Like the fact that both fuel filters are packaged in one box and they are Motorcraft.
customer_reviews.author: Norman

customer_reviews.title: Great value and perfect fit on 2012 F250
customer_reviews.text: Much better price than the dealer for the exact same product
customer_reviews.author: Rick32

customer_reviews.title: The only filters I will use!
customer_reviews.text: The only fuel filters for your Ford truck. Don’t settle for inferior off-brand filters.
